question: ________ is the process of visiting each element in a data structure exactly once.
Insertion is the operation of ________ a new element into a data structure.
In an array, deletion involves removing an element and then ________ the remaining elements to maintain order.
The operation that allows accessing each element of a data structure is called ________.
If an element is inserted in the middle of an array, the elements after it must be ________.
To delete an element from an array, you need to shift the remaining elements to the ________.
The process of accessing elements of an array one by one is called ________.
In an array, the last element has no ________.
If you want to insert an element at the beginning of an array, all other elements must be ________ one position.
To delete an element from an array, we must first identify its ________.
